alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 11 at 8:36PM MST until August 11 at 11:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE ANTELOPE CREEK BASIN REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM MST/1230 AM MDT/ THIS EVENING FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 834 PM MST /934 PM MDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain has ended with light rain continuing at this time over the Antelope Creek basin. Between 0.75 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen upstream of Antelope Canyon and will cause flooding in the canyon over the next couple of hours. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding in and around the Antelope Creek basin. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Antelope Creek basin. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Antelope Creek Basin, Cardiac Canyon, Canyon X, Wind Pebble Canyon, Porcupine Canyon, Ramshead Canyon, Mountain Sheep Canyon, Rattlesnake Canyon, Owl Canyon, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Lake Powell and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following slot canyons... Upper Antelope Canyon, Lower Antelope Canyon, Canyon X, Cardiac Canyon, Owl Canyon, Rattlesnake Canyon, Mountain Sheep Canyon, Ramshead Canyon, Wind Pebble Canyon and Porcupine Canyon. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Antelope Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Get out of Antelope Canyon and other area slot canyons immediately! Deadly flash flooding is imminent or occurring! Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Slot canyons can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
